outputs.output_descr:
Human Rights aspect to HIV/AIDS Response in Cameroon. UNDP support will essentially focus on building technical capacity on Human rights and Gender sensitization and advocacy to combat HIV. Specifically, actions will be carried out on preventing the infection, improving access to care, support and treatment towards these vulnerable groups. 
The aim is to promote the respect of women, young girls and minorities' human rights and mitigate the impact of HIV/aids within them.
As mentioned above, the project is targeting vulnerable groups (minorities, women and young girls) in 4 regions: Centre, East, Littoral and North West within 18 months. Community-based organizations (CBOs) working with these targeted groups in those regions will be identified.  

The strategy of intervention will consist on transferring competencies and appropriation by the CBOs in order to address different types of vulnerability and human rights abuses (social, economic, physiologic, sexual and cultural) faced by minorities, women and young girls.

project_title: Human Rights aspect to HIV/AIDS Response in Cameroon
